Operation 'updateEmailCampaign' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_side_effects. Missing summary entirely. data.current_description:
This method lets users update an existing email campaign. Pass the emailCampaignId in the request URL and specify the changes to field values in the request payload.

Note: You can only update the custom fields of an email campaign. Fixed values, such as the emailCampaignType, cannot be changed. For full specifications of fixed values for each email campaign type, see the createEmailCampaign method documentation.
data.summary_suggestion: Update email campaign custom fields
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing email campaign with new values for custom fields. Pass the email_campaign_id in the URL path and provide the fields to update in the request body. Only custom fields can be modified; fixed fields such as emailCampaignType cannot be changed. Returns the updated campaign. Note: Refer to createEmailCampaign documentation for field specifications by campaign type.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description has good detail but lacks clarity about what fields are updatable and doesn't explicitly state the return value. Added summary and clarified which fields can/cannot be modified, what the operation returns, and cross-referenced the createEmailCampaign method for field specifications to help AI agents understand constraints.

data.current_description:
This method deletes the email campaign specified by the email_campaign_id path parameter.

Call getEmailCampaigns to retrieve all of the seller's email campaigns. Use the email_campaign_id of the desired email campaign in the response as the path parameter for this request.
data.summary_suggestion: Delete an email campaign
data.description_suggestion: Deletes the email campaign specified by the email_campaign_id path parameter. This action is permanent and cannot be undone. Call getEmailCampaigns to retrieve available campaigns and obtain the email_campaign_id. Returns a 200 status on successful deletion with no response body.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks clarity about permanence of deletion and what the response contains. data.current_description:
This method retrieves all available email newsletter audiences for the email campaign type specified by the emailCampaignType path parameter.

Use the optional limit and offset path parameters to paginate the results and to control which records are returned, respectively.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve available email campaign audiences
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all available email newsletter audiences for a specified email campaign type. The emailCampaignType query parameter filters audiences by campaign type. Use the optional limit parameter to control the number of results returned and offset parameter for pagination. Returns a list of CampaignAudience objects that can be used when creating or updating email campaigns.

message: Operation 'getEmailPreview' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary. Description is verbose and unclear about the exact response structure. Added concise summary, clarified that content field contains HTML, specified renderDate in response, and simplified the note about listings being dynamic. This helps AI agents quickly understand the operation returns renderable HTML content.

data.current_description:
This method returns a preview of the email sent by the email campaign indicated by the email_campaign_id path parameter.

Call getEmailCampaigns to obtain a list of email campaigns. Use the emailCampaignId value of the desired email campaign as the email_campaign_id path parameter value.

If this call is executed successfully, the response returns a content field that contains the raw HTML code of the email campaign that can then be rendered anywhere.

Note: The eBay listings in the email are sorted according to the email campaign sort criteria. The individual listings can change over time, as well.

The result of the email preview call can be treated as a snapshot of the email campaign taken at the date and time of the renderDate value found in the results of the call.
data.summary_suggestion: Get email campaign preview as HTML
data.description_suggestion: Returns a preview of the email that will be sent by the specified email campaign. Pass the email_campaign_id in the URL path. The response contains a content field with the raw HTML code of the email, which can be rendered in any HTML viewer. Also returns a renderDate indicating when the preview was generated. Note: Email listings are sorted per campaign criteria and may change over time; treat preview as a snapshot at the renderDate.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is verbose and unclear about the exact response structure. Added concise summary, clarified that content field contains HTML, specified renderDate in response, and simplified the note about listings being dynamic. This helps AI agents quickly understand the operation returns renderable HTML content.

Description lacks clarity about parameter format requirements and doesn't specify what metrics are returned. Added summary, clarified that dates are query parameters in ISO 8601 UTC format with example, specified the one-year limit, and listed example metrics (opens, clicks) to help AI agents understand what data to expect and when to use this operation.

data.current_description:
This method returns the seller's email campaign performance report for a time period specified by the startDate and endDate path parameters. The maximum date range for a report retrieved by this method is one year.

Note: The startDate and endDate must be given in UTC format, as shown in the following example:
sell/marketing/v1/email_campaign/report?startDate=2022-11-01T19:09:02.768Z&endDate=2022-12-28T19:09:02.768Z
The email report returns a list of metrics, such as the number of times an email report has been opened and resulted in clicks.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve email campaign performance metrics
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves email campaign performance metrics for a specified time period. Requires startDate and endDate query parameters in UTC format (ISO 8601). Maximum date range is one year. Returns performance metrics including email open count, click-through count, and other engagement indicators. Use this report to analyze campaign effectiveness and optimize marketing strategies.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks clarity about parameter format requirements and doesn't specify what metrics are returned. Added summary, clarified that dates are query parameters in ISO 8601 UTC format with example, specified the one-year limit, and listed example metrics (opens, clicks) to help AI agents understand what data to expect and when to use this operation.

message: Operation 'pausePromotion' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, inconsistent_terminology. Missing summary entirely. Description contains outdated terminology references that should be streamlined. The parameter name 'promotion_id' is inconsistent with the current terminology shift to 'discounts'. Improved summary provides clear action and scope. Improved description removes redundant terminology notes, clarifies state changes, specifies discount type restrictions, and provides better AI agent guidance on prerequisites and limitations.

data.current_description:
Note: As of July 8th 2024, promotions are now being referred to as discounts on Seller Hub and eBay help pages. Sell Marketing API documentation has been updated to reflect this product name change, but note that no API interface changes have been made.
This method pauses a currently-active (RUNNING) threshold discount and changes the state of the discount from RUNNING to PAUSED. Pausing a discount makes the discount temporarily unavailable to buyers and any currently-incomplete transactions will not receive the offer until the discount is resumed. Also, discount teasers are not displayed when a discount is paused.

Pass the ID of the discount you want to pause using the promotion_id path parameter. Call getPromotions to retrieve the IDs of the seller's discounts.

Note: You can only pause threshold discounts (you cannot pause markdown discounts).
data.summary_suggestion: Pause a running threshold discount
data.description_suggestion: Pauses a currently-active (RUNNING) threshold discount and changes its state to PAUSED. When paused, the discount becomes temporarily unavailable to buyers, incomplete transactions will not receive the offer, and discount teasers will not be displayed. Requires the discount ID via the promotion_id path parameter. Only threshold discounts can be paused; markdown discounts cannot be paused. Use getPromotions to retrieve available discount IDs.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description contains outdated terminology references that should be streamlined. The parameter name 'promotion_id' is inconsistent with the current terminology shift to 'discounts'. Improved summary provides clear action and scope. Improved description removes redundant terminology notes, clarifies state changes, specifies discount type restrictions, and provides better AI agent guidance on prerequisites and limitations.

Improved description removes unnecessary terminology notes, clarifies state transition and eligibility restoration, specifies prerequisites, and improves AI agent understanding of when this operation is applicable.

data.current_description:
Note: As of July 8th 2024, promotions are now being referred to as discounts on Seller Hub and eBay help pages. Sell Marketing API documentation has been updated to reflect this product name change, but note that no API interface changes have been made.
This method restarts a threshold discount that was previously paused and changes the state of the discount from PAUSED to RUNNING. Only discounts that have been previously paused can be resumed. Resuming a discount reinstates the teasers and any transactions that were in motion before the discount was paused will again be eligible for the discount.

Pass the ID of the discount you want to resume using the promotion_id path parameter. Call getPromotions to retrieve the IDs of the seller's discounts.
data.summary_suggestion: Resume a paused threshold discount
data.description_suggestion: Resumes a threshold discount that was previously paused and changes its state from PAUSED to RUNNING. When resumed, discount teasers are reinstated and transactions that were in progress before the pause become eligible for the discount again. Only discounts in PAUSED state can be resumed. Requires the discount ID via the promotion_id path parameter. Use getPromotions to retrieve available discount IDs.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description contains redundant terminology transition notes that clutter the core information. Parameter naming inconsistency with current 'discount' terminology. Improved summary provides clear action and scope. Improved description removes unnecessary terminology notes, clarifies state transition and eligibility restoration, specifies prerequisites, and improves AI agent understanding of when this operation is applicable.

data.current_description:
This method clones (makes a copy of) the specified campaign's campaign criterion. The campaign criterion is a container for the fields that define the criteria for a rule-based campaign.

To clone a campaign, supply the campaign_id as a path parameter in your call. There is no request payload.

The ID of the newly-cloned campaign is returned in the Location response header.

Call getCampaigns to retrieve a seller's current campaign IDs.

Requirement: In order to clone a campaign, the campaignStatus must be ENDED and the campaign must define a set of selection rules (it must be a rules-based campaign).

Note: This method only applies to the Cost Per Sale (CPS) funding model; it does not apply to the Cost Per Click (CPC) funding model. See Funding Models in the Promoted Listings Playbook for more information.
data.summary_suggestion: Clone an ended rule-based campaign
data.description_suggestion: Creates a copy of an ended rule-based Promoted Listings campaign with its campaign criteria and selection rules. Requires the campaign_id as a path parameter; no request body needed. The newly-cloned campaign ID is returned in the Location response header. Prerequisites: source campaign must have status ENDED and must be rules-based (not keyword-based). Only applies to Cost Per Sale (CPS) funding model campaigns, not Cost Per Click (CPC) campaigns.

data.current_description:
This method can be used to create a Promoted Listings general, priority, or offsite campaign.

A Promoted Listings campaign is the structure in which you place the ads or ad group for the listings you wish to promote.

Note: Campaigns can only contain ads for a maximum of 50,000 items.
General strategy campaigns utilize a Cost Per Sale (CPS) funding model. Sellers can set the ad rate and bidding strategies that are right for their business through the adRateStrategy, biddingStrategy, bidPercentage fields. For more information on general strategy campaigns, see Promoted Listings general strategy campaign flow.

Priority strategy campaigns utilize a Cost per Click (CPC) funding model. Sellers can create a daily budget through the budget container and choose what channel that their ads appear on. In addition, priority strategy campaigns give sellers the ability to create ad groups and specify keywords to ensure their ads reach their intended audience. For more information on priority strategy campaigns, see Promoted listings priority strategy campaign flow.

Promoted Offsite campaigns give sellers the ability to create their own advertising campaign and promote their eBay listing in leading external search channels. For more information on Promoted Offsite campaigns, see Promoted Offsite.

Note: Sellers can use the getAdvertisingEligibility method of the Account API v1 to determine their eligibility status for eBay advertising programs.
To create a basic campaign, supply:
  • The user-defined campaign name
  • The start date (and optionally the end date) of the campaign
  • The eBay marketplace on which the campaign is hosted
  • Details on the campaign funding model
For details on creating Promoted Listings campaigns and how to select the items to be included in your campaigns, see Promoted Listings campaign creation.
data.summary_suggestion: Create a Promoted Listings campaign
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new Promoted Listings campaign of type general (CPS), priority (CPC), or offsite. Required inputs: campaign name, start date, marketplace, and funding model details. General campaigns support adRateStrategy, biddingStrategy, and bidPercentage configuration. Priority campaigns support daily budget and channel selection with ad groups and keywords. Campaigns can contain up to 50,000 items. Returns the newly created campaign ID. Verify seller eligibility using getAdvertisingEligibility before creating campaigns.

data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve campaign details by exact campaign name
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the complete details of a single ad campaign by its name. Requires an exact, case-sensitive match of the campaign_name query parameter. Returns the full campaign object including configuration, status, and performance settings. Use getCampaigns to retrieve a list of available campaign names if the exact name is unknown.

data.current_description:
This method launches a priority strategy campaign created using the setupQuickCampaign method that is in DRAFT status. This changes the campaign status to RUNNING or SCHEDULED, based on its specified start date. Specify the campaign you wish to launch by supplying its campaign_id as a path parameter in the call URI.

Use the getCampaigns method to retrieve the campaign_id and the campaign status for all the seller's campaigns.
data.summary_suggestion: Launch a draft priority strategy campaign
data.description_suggestion: Launches a priority strategy campaign in DRAFT status, transitioning it to RUNNING or SCHEDULED state based on its configured start date. Requires the campaign_id as a path parameter. Only applies to campaigns created via setupQuickCampaign. Returns the updated campaign object with new status. Side effect: Campaign begins serving ads immediately if start date is current, or becomes scheduled for future start date.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks clarity on return value and side effects. Improved summary specifies campaign type and current status. Enhanced description clarifies status transitions, return value, and side effects (ads begin serving) for better AI agent understanding of operation consequences.

message: Operation 'pauseCampaign' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Missing summary. Description lacks explicit return value and doesn't clearly organize side effects. Improved summary is action-oriented. Enhanced description specifies return value, clearly lists side effects including the important constraint about listings, and clarifies resumption conditions for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
This method pauses an active (RUNNING) campaign.

You can restart the campaign by calling resumeCampaign, as long as the campaign's end date is in the future.

Note:The listings associated with a paused campaign cannot be added into another campaign.

Call getCampaigns to retrieve the campaign_id and the campaign status (RUNNING, PAUSED, ENDED, and so on) for all the seller's campaigns.
data.summary_suggestion: Pause an active ad campaign
data.description_suggestion: Pauses an active (RUNNING) ad campaign, stopping ad delivery while preserving campaign configuration. Requires campaign_id as path parameter. Returns the updated campaign object with PAUSED status. Side effects: (1) Campaign ads stop serving immediately, (2) Listings in paused campaign cannot be added to other campaigns, (3) Campaign can be resumed via resumeCampaign if end date is in the future.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks explicit return value and doesn't clearly organize side effects. Improved summary is action-oriented. Enhanced description specifies return value, clearly lists side effects including the important constraint about listings, and clarifies resumption conditions for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
This method resumes a paused campaign, as long as its end date is in the future. Supply the campaign_id for the campaign you want to restart as a query parameter in the request.

Call getCampaigns to retrieve the campaign_id and the campaign status (RUNNING, PAUSED, ENDED, and so on) for all the seller's campaigns.
data.summary_suggestion: Resume a paused ad campaign
data.description_suggestion: Resumes a paused ad campaign, transitioning it back to RUNNING status and resuming ad delivery. Requires campaign_id as path parameter. Only succeeds if campaign end date is in the future. Returns the updated campaign object with RUNNING status. Side effect: Campaign ads resume serving immediately upon successful resumption.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks clarity on return value and side effects, and incorrectly states campaign_id is a query parameter when it should be path parameter. Improved summary is action-oriented. Enhanced description corrects parameter location, specifies return value, clarifies the end-date precondition, and explains side effects.

message: Operation 'setupQuickCampaign' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary. Description is lengthy and lacks clear return value specification. Improved summary emphasizes key differentiator (auto-generated keywords). Enhanced description consolidates requirements, clarifies automatic processing, specifies return value and status code, and highlights the DRAFT status and next steps for better AI agent workflow understanding.

data.current_description:
This method allows the seller to expedite the creation of a priority strategy campaign.

Sellers only need to provide basic campaign information, such as the user-defined campaign name, the start date (and optionally the end date) of the campaign, the daily budget amount of the campaign, and the eBay marketplace where the campaign will be hosted. The seller must also identify the items they want to place in the campaign by adding the listing id of each item in the listingIds array of the request.

Using the provided listingIds, eBay creates ad groups for the campaign and organizes the listings into the appropriate ad group. eBay then adds keywords to each ad group and assigns each keyword a suggested bid.

By default, campaigns created using setupQuickCampaign utilize a FIXED keyword bidding strategy which means that a seller manually assigns and adjusts keyword bids for their CPC campaign.

Alternatively, once the campaign has been created, sellers may opt to utilize a DYNAMIC bidding strategy which means that eBay will manage a campaign's keyword bids and automatically update them daily to the suggested bid.

For additional information about FIXED and DYNAMIC bidding strategies, refer to updateBiddingStrategy.

Campaigns created using this method will be in DRAFT status upon creation.

The location response header returned contains the getCampaign URI to retrieve the newly created campaign that is in draft status. Sellers should make this call to review and approve the campaign before they use the launchCampaign method to start the campaign.

Note: General strategy ad campaigns are not supported.
data.summary_suggestion: Create a priority strategy campaign with auto-generated keywords
data.description_suggestion: Creates a priority strategy campaign with automatically generated ad groups, keywords, and suggested bids. Requires: campaign name, start date, daily budget, marketplace, and listingIds array. eBay automatically organizes listings into ad groups and assigns keywords with suggested bids. Returns 201 with Location header containing getCampaign URI. Campaign created in DRAFT status with FIXED bidding strategy by default (can be changed to DYNAMIC via updateBiddingStrategy). Must call launchCampaign to activate. Note: General strategy campaigns not supported.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is lengthy and lacks clear return value specification. Improved summary emphasizes key differentiator (auto-generated keywords). Enhanced description consolidates requirements, clarifies automatic processing, specifies return value and status code, and highlights the DRAFT status and next steps for better AI agent workflow understanding.

Note: This method is only supported for Promoted Offsite campaigns. Sellers can use the getAdvertisingEligibility method of the Account API v1 to determine if they are eligible for offsite campaigns.
This method allows sellers to retrieve the suggested budget for an offsite campaign.
data.summary_suggestion: Get recommended daily budget for offsite campaign
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves eBay's recommended daily budget amount for a Promoted Offsite campaign. Applies only to Promoted Offsite campaigns; verify eligibility using Account API's getAdvertisingEligibility method first. Returns suggested budget amount based on seller's inventory and market conditions. Use this recommendation to optimize campaign spending and performance.

data.current_description:
This method lets users update an existing email campaign. Pass the emailCampaignId in the request URL and specify the changes to field values in the request payload.

Note: You can only update the custom fields of an email campaign. Fixed values, such as the emailCampaignType, cannot be changed. For full specifications of fixed values for each email campaign type, see the createEmailCampaign method documentation.
data.summary_suggestion: Update email campaign custom fields
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing email campaign with new values for custom fields. Pass the email_campaign_id in the URL path and provide the fields to update in the request body. Only custom fields can be modified; fixed fields such as emailCampaignType cannot be changed. Returns the updated campaign. Note: Refer to createEmailCampaign documentation for field specifications by campaign type.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description has good detail but lacks clarity about what fields are updatable and doesn't explicitly state the return value. Added summary and clarified which fields can/cannot be modified, what the operation returns, and cross-referenced the createEmailCampaign method for field specifications to help AI agents understand constraints.

message: Operation 'deleteEmailCampaign' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary. Description lacks clarity about permanence of deletion and what the response contains. Added summary and clarified that deletion is permanent, specified the response behavior (200 status with no body), and maintained reference to getEmailCampaigns for discovering campaign IDs.

data.current_description:
This method deletes the email campaign specified by the email_campaign_id path parameter.

Call getEmailCampaigns to retrieve all of the seller's email campaigns. Use the email_campaign_id of the desired email campaign in the response as the path parameter for this request.
data.summary_suggestion: Delete an email campaign

data.current_description:
This method returns a preview of the email sent by the email campaign indicated by the email_campaign_id path parameter.

Call getEmailCampaigns to obtain a list of email campaigns. Use the emailCampaignId value of the desired email campaign as the email_campaign_id path parameter value.

If this call is executed successfully, the response returns a content field that contains the raw HTML code of the email campaign that can then be rendered anywhere.

Note: The eBay listings in the email are sorted according to the email campaign sort criteria. The individual listings can change over time, as well.

The result of the email preview call can be treated as a snapshot of the email campaign taken at the date and time of the renderDate value found in the results of the call.
data.summary_suggestion: Get email campaign preview as HTML
data.description_suggestion: Returns a preview of the email that will be sent by the specified email campaign. Pass the email_campaign_id in the URL path. The response contains a content field with the raw HTML code of the email, which can be rendered in any HTML viewer. Also returns a renderDate indicating when the preview was generated. Note: Email listings are sorted per campaign criteria and may change over time; treat preview as a snapshot at the renderDate.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is verbose and unclear about the exact response structure. sell/marketing/v1/email_campaign/report?startDate=2022-11-01T19:09:02.768Z&endDate=2022-12-28T19:09:02.768Z
The email report returns a list of metrics, such as the number of times an email report has been opened and resulted in clicks.

data.current_description:
Note: As of July 8th 2024, promotions are now being referred to as discounts on Seller Hub and eBay help pages. Sell Marketing API documentation has been updated to reflect this product name change, but note that no API interface changes have been made.
This method pauses a currently-active (RUNNING) threshold discount and changes the state of the discount from RUNNING to PAUSED. Pausing a discount makes the discount temporarily unavailable to buyers and any currently-incomplete transactions will not receive the offer until the discount is resumed. Also, discount teasers are not displayed when a discount is paused.

Pass the ID of the discount you want to pause using the promotion_id path parameter. Call getPromotions to retrieve the IDs of the seller's discounts.

Note: You can only pause threshold discounts (you cannot pause markdown discounts).
data.summary_suggestion: Pause a running threshold discount
data.description_suggestion: Pauses a currently-active (RUNNING) threshold discount and changes its state to PAUSED. When paused, the discount becomes temporarily unavailable to buyers, incomplete transactions will not receive the offer, and discount teasers will not be displayed. Requires the discount ID via the promotion_id path parameter. Only threshold discounts can be paused; markdown discounts cannot be paused. Use getPromotions to retrieve available discount IDs.

The parameter name 'promotion_id' is inconsistent with the current terminology shift to 'discounts'. Improved summary provides clear action and scope. This method restarts a threshold discount that was previously paused and changes the state of the discount from PAUSED to RUNNING. Only discounts that have been previously paused can be resumed. Resuming a discount reinstates the teasers and any transactions that were in motion before the discount was paused will again be eligible for the discount.

Pass the ID of the discount you want to resume using the promotion_id path parameter. Call getPromotions to retrieve the IDs of the seller's discounts.

When resumed, discount teasers are reinstated and transactions that were in progress before the pause become eligible for the discount again. Only discounts in PAUSED state can be resumed. Requires the discount ID via the promotion_id path parameter. Use getPromotions to retrieve available discount IDs.

data.current_description:
This method clones (makes a copy of) the specified campaign's campaign criterion. The campaign criterion is a container for the fields that define the criteria for a rule-based campaign.

To clone a campaign, supply the campaign_id as a path parameter in your call. There is no request payload.

The ID of the newly-cloned campaign is returned in the Location response header.

Call getCampaigns to retrieve a seller's current campaign IDs.

Requirement: In order to clone a campaign, the campaignStatus must be ENDED and the campaign must define a set of selection rules (it must be a rules-based campaign).

Note: This method only applies to the Cost Per Sale (CPS) funding model; it does not apply to the Cost Per Click (CPC) funding model. See Funding Models in the Promoted Listings Playbook for more information.
data.summary_suggestion: Clone an ended rule-based campaign
data.description_suggestion: Creates a copy of an ended rule-based Promoted Listings campaign with its campaign criteria and selection rules. Requires the campaign_id as a path parameter; no request body needed. The newly-cloned campaign ID is returned in the Location response header. Prerequisites: source campaign must have status ENDED and must be rules-based (not keyword-based). Only applies to Cost Per Sale (CPS) funding model campaigns, not Cost Per Click (CPC) campaigns.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is lengthy but lacks clear prerequisites upfront. Reorganized to emphasize requirements (ENDED status, rules-based, CPS model) and clarify that cloning creates a new campaign with a new ID returned in headers, improving AI agent understanding of when this operation is applicable.

This method retrieves the details for all of the seller's defined campaigns. Request parameters can be used to retrieve a specific campaign, such as the campaign's name, the start and end date, the channel, the status, and the funding model (i.e., Cost Per Sale (CPS) or Cost Per Click (CPC)).

You can filter the result set by a campaign name, end date range, start date range, campaign channel, or campaign status. You can also paginate the records returned from the result set using the limit query parameter, and control which records to return using the offset parameter.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve seller's Promoted Listings campaigns
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all of the seller's Promoted Listings campaigns with optional filtering and pagination. data.current_description:
This method can be used to create a Promoted Listings general, priority, or offsite campaign.

A Promoted Listings campaign is the structure in which you place the ads or ad group for the listings you wish to promote.

Note: Campaigns can only contain ads for a maximum of 50,000 items.
General strategy campaigns utilize a Cost Per Sale (CPS) funding model. Sellers can set the ad rate and bidding strategies that are right for their business through the adRateStrategy, biddingStrategy, bidPercentage fields. For more information on general strategy campaigns, see Promoted Listings general strategy campaign flow.

Priority strategy campaigns utilize a Cost per Click (CPC) funding model. Sellers can create a daily budget through the budget container and choose what channel that their ads appear on. In addition, priority strategy campaigns give sellers the ability to create ad groups and specify keywords to ensure their ads reach their intended audience. For more information on priority strategy campaigns, see Promoted listings priority strategy campaign flow.

Promoted Offsite campaigns give sellers the ability to create their own advertising campaign and promote their eBay listing in leading external search channels. For more information on Promoted Offsite campaigns, see Promoted Offsite.

Note: Sellers can use the getAdvertisingEligibility method of the Account API v1 to determine their eligibility status for eBay advertising programs.
To create a basic campaign, supply:
  • The user-defined campaign name
  • The start date (and optionally the end date) of the campaign
  • The eBay marketplace on which the campaign is hosted
  • Details on the campaign funding model
For details on creating Promoted Listings campaigns and how to select the items to be included in your campaigns, see Promoted Listings campaign creation.
data.summary_suggestion: Create a Promoted Listings campaign
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new Promoted Listings campaign of type general (CPS), priority (CPC), or offsite. Required inputs: campaign name, start date, marketplace, and funding model details. General campaigns support adRateStrategy, biddingStrategy, and bidPercentage configuration. Priority campaigns support daily budget and channel selection with ad groups and keywords. Campaigns can contain up to 50,000 items. Returns the newly created campaign ID. Verify seller eligibility using getAdvertisingEligibility before creating campaigns.

data.current_description:
This method retrieves the campaigns containing the listing that is specified using either a listing ID, or an inventory reference ID and inventory reference type pair. The request accepts either a listing_id, or an inventory_reference_id and inventory_reference_type pair, as used in the Inventory API.

eBay listing IDs are generated by either the Trading API or the Inventory API when you create a listing.

An inventory reference ID can be either a seller-defined SKU or inventoryItemGroupKey, as specified in the Inventory API.

Note: This method only applies to the Cost Per Sale (CPS) funding model; it does not apply to the Cost Per Click (CPC) funding model. See Funding Models in the Promoted Listings Playbook for more information.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve campaigns containing a specific listing

Accepts one of two input formats: (1) a listing_id generated by the Trading API or Inventory API, or (2) an inventory_reference_id (seller-defined SKU or inventoryItemGroupKey) paired with inventory_reference_type. Returns a list of campaigns containing the specified listing. Note: This method applies only to Cost Per Sale (CPS) funding model campaigns, not Cost Per Click (CPC) campaigns.

data.current_description:
This method pauses an active (RUNNING) campaign.

You can restart the campaign by calling resumeCampaign, as long as the campaign's end date is in the future.

Note:The listings associated with a paused campaign cannot be added into another campaign.

Call getCampaigns to retrieve the campaign_id and the campaign status (RUNNING, PAUSED, ENDED, and so on) for all the seller's campaigns.
data.summary_suggestion: Pause an active ad campaign

Returns the updated campaign object with PAUSED status. Side effects: (1) Campaign ads stop serving immediately, (2) Listings in paused campaign cannot be added to other campaigns, (3) Campaign can be resumed via resumeCampaign if end date is in the future.

data.current_description:
This method allows the seller to expedite the creation of a priority strategy campaign.

Sellers only need to provide basic campaign information, such as the user-defined campaign name, the start date (and optionally the end date) of the campaign, the daily budget amount of the campaign, and the eBay marketplace where the campaign will be hosted. The seller must also identify the items they want to place in the campaign by adding the listing id of each item in the listingIds array of the request.

Using the provided listingIds, eBay creates ad groups for the campaign and organizes the listings into the appropriate ad group. eBay then adds keywords to each ad group and assigns each keyword a suggested bid.

By default, campaigns created using setupQuickCampaign utilize a FIXED keyword bidding strategy which means that a seller manually assigns and adjusts keyword bids for their CPC campaign.

Alternatively, once the campaign has been created, sellers may opt to utilize a DYNAMIC bidding strategy which means that eBay will manage a campaign's keyword bids and automatically update them daily to the suggested bid.

For additional information about FIXED and DYNAMIC bidding strategies, refer to updateBiddingStrategy.

Campaigns created using this method will be in DRAFT status upon creation.

The location response header returned contains the getCampaign URI to retrieve the newly created campaign that is in draft status. Sellers should make this call to review and approve the campaign before they use the launchCampaign method to start the campaign.

Note: General strategy ad campaigns are not supported.
data.summary_suggestion: Create a priority strategy campaign with auto-generated keywords
data.description_suggestion: Creates a priority strategy campaign with automatically generated ad groups, keywords, and suggested bids. Requires: campaign name, start date, daily budget, marketplace, and listingIds array. eBay automatically organizes listings into ad groups and assigns keywords with suggested bids. Returns 201 with Location header containing getCampaign URI. Campaign created in DRAFT status with FIXED bidding strategy by default (can be changed to DYNAMIC via updateBiddingStrategy). Must call launchCampaign to activate. Note: General strategy campaigns not supported.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is lengthy and lacks clear return value specification. Improved summary emphasizes key differentiator (auto-generated keywords). Enhanced description consolidates requirements, clarifies automatic processing, specifies return value and status code, and highlights the DRAFT status and next steps for better AI agent workflow understanding.

data.current_description:
This method lets users update an existing email campaign. Pass the emailCampaignId in the request URL and specify the changes to field values in the request payload.

Note: You can only update the custom fields of an email campaign. Fixed values, such as the emailCampaignType, cannot be changed. For full specifications of fixed values for each email campaign type, see the createEmailCampaign method documentation.
data.summary_suggestion: Update email campaign custom fields
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing email campaign with new values for custom fields. Pass the email_campaign_id in the URL path and provide the fields to update in the request body. Only custom fields can be modified; fixed fields such as emailCampaignType cannot be changed. Returns the updated campaign. Note: Refer to createEmailCampaign documentation for field specifications by campaign type.

data.current_description:
This method returns a preview of the email sent by the email campaign indicated by the email_campaign_id path parameter.

Call getEmailCampaigns to obtain a list of email campaigns. Use the emailCampaignId value of the desired email campaign as the email_campaign_id path parameter value.

If this call is executed successfully, the response returns a content field that contains the raw HTML code of the email campaign that can then be rendered anywhere.

Note: The eBay listings in the email are sorted according to the email campaign sort criteria. The individual listings can change over time, as well.

The result of the email preview call can be treated as a snapshot of the email campaign taken at the date and time of the renderDate value found in the results of the call.
data.summary_suggestion: Get email campaign preview as HTML
data.description_suggestion: Returns a preview of the email that will be sent by the specified email campaign. Pass the email_campaign_id in the URL path. The response contains the raw HTML content of the email campaign in the content field, which can be rendered in any HTML viewer. The preview represents a snapshot at the renderDate timestamp. Note: Listings in the email are sorted per campaign criteria and may change over time. Call getEmailCampaigns to obtain the email_campaign_id.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is verbose and unclear about the response format. Added concise summary indicating HTML output. Reorganized description to clearly state what is returned (HTML content), where it's located (content field), and what it represents (snapshot at renderDate). data.current_description:
This method returns the seller's email campaign performance report for a time period specified by the startDate and endDate path parameters. The maximum date range for a report retrieved by this method is one year.

Note: The startDate and endDate must be given in UTC format, as shown in the following example:
sell/marketing/v1/email_campaign/report?startDate=2022-11-01T19:09:02.768Z&endDate=2022-12-28T19:09:02.768Z
The email report returns a list of metrics, such as the number of times an email report has been opened and resulted in clicks.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve email campaign performance metrics
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves email campaign performance metrics for a specified time period. Provide startDate and endDate as UTC-formatted query parameters (e.g., 2022-11-01T19:09:02.768Z). Maximum date range is one year. Returns performance metrics including email open count, click-through count, and other engagement indicators. Use this report to analyze campaign effectiveness and optimize future campaigns.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks clarity about parameter format (query vs path), doesn't specify what metrics are included, and doesn't explain the use case. Added summary and clarified that dates are query parameters in UTC format, specified the maximum date range constraint, listed example metrics (opens, clicks), and explained the business purpose for AI agents to understand when to use this operation.

data.current_description:
Note: As of July 8th 2024, promotions are now being referred to as discounts on Seller Hub and eBay help pages. Sell Marketing API documentation has been updated to reflect this product name change, but note that no API interface changes have been made.
This method pauses a currently-active (RUNNING) threshold discount and changes the state of the discount from RUNNING to PAUSED. Pausing a discount makes the discount temporarily unavailable to buyers and any currently-incomplete transactions will not receive the offer until the discount is resumed. Also, discount teasers are not displayed when a discount is paused.

Pass the ID of the discount you want to pause using the promotion_id path parameter. Call getPromotions to retrieve the IDs of the seller's discounts.

Note: You can only pause threshold discounts (you cannot pause markdown discounts).
data.summary_suggestion: Pause a running threshold discount
data.description_suggestion: Pauses a currently-active (RUNNING) threshold discount and changes its state to PAUSED. When paused, the discount becomes temporarily unavailable to buyers, incomplete transactions will not receive the offer, and discount teasers will not be displayed. Requires the discount ID via the promotion_id path parameter. Only threshold discounts can be paused; markdown discounts cannot be paused. Use getPromotions to retrieve available discount IDs.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description contains outdated terminology references that should be streamlined. The parameter name 'promotion_id' is inconsistent with the current terminology shift to 'discounts'. Improved summary provides clear action and scope. data.current_description:
Note: As of July 8th 2024, promotions are now being referred to as discounts on Seller Hub and eBay help pages. Sell Marketing API documentation has been updated to reflect this product name change, but note that no API interface changes have been made.
This method restarts a threshold discount that was previously paused and changes the state of the discount from PAUSED to RUNNING. Only discounts that have been previously paused can be resumed. Resuming a discount reinstates the teasers and any transactions that were in motion before the discount was paused will again be eligible for the discount.

Pass the ID of the discount you want to resume using the promotion_id path parameter. Call getPromotions to retrieve the IDs of the seller's discounts.
data.summary_suggestion: Resume a paused threshold discount
data.description_suggestion: Resumes a threshold discount that was previously paused and changes its state from PAUSED to RUNNING. When resumed, discount teasers are reinstated and transactions that were in progress before the pause become eligible for the discount again. Only discounts in PAUSED state can be resumed. Requires the discount ID via the promotion_id path parameter. Use getPromotions to retrieve available discount IDs.

This method creates a new email campaign. An eBay store owner can create six different types of email campaigns: Welcome, New products & collections, Coupon, Sale event + markdown, Order discount, and Volume pricing.

A successful createEmailCampaign request returns the emailCampaignId assigned to the new email campaign.

The fields emailCampaignType, audienceCodes, itemSelectMode, subject, and personalizedMessage are required for all email campaign types.

Specific email campaign types have required values for additional fields. For more information on the email campaign types, see the Store Email Campaigns section of the Selling Integration Guide.

Required fields for all types: emailCampaignType, audienceCodes, itemSelectMode, subject, and personalizedMessage. Additional required fields vary by campaign type. Returns the newly created emailCampaignId. Refer to Store Email Campaigns documentation for type-specific requirements.

data.current_description:
This method retrieves the campaigns containing the listing that is specified using either a listing ID, or an inventory reference ID and inventory reference type pair. The request accepts either a listing_id, or an inventory_reference_id and inventory_reference_type pair, as used in the Inventory API.

eBay listing IDs are generated by either the Trading API or the Inventory API when you create a listing.

An inventory reference ID can be either a seller-defined SKU or inventoryItemGroupKey, as specified in the Inventory API.

Note: This method only applies to the Cost Per Sale (CPS) funding model; it does not apply to the Cost Per Click (CPC) funding model. See Funding Models in the Promoted Listings Playbook for more information.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve campaigns containing a specific listing
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all ad campaigns containing a listing specified by either listing ID or inventory reference ID. Accepts one of two input formats: (1) a listing_id generated by the Trading API or Inventory API, or (2) an inventory_reference_id (seller-defined SKU or inventoryItemGroupKey) paired with inventory_reference_type. Returns a list of campaigns containing the specified listing. Note: This method applies only to Cost Per Sale (CPS) funding model campaigns, not Cost Per Click (CPC) campaigns.

Side effect: Campaign begins serving ads immediately if start date is current, or becomes scheduled for future start date.

data.current_description:
This method pauses an active (RUNNING) campaign.

You can restart the campaign by calling resumeCampaign, as long as the campaign's end date is in the future.

Note:The listings associated with a paused campaign cannot be added into another campaign.

Call getCampaigns to retrieve the campaign_id and the campaign status (RUNNING, PAUSED, ENDED, and so on) for all the seller's campaigns.

data.current_description:
This method allows the seller to expedite the creation of a priority strategy campaign.

Sellers only need to provide basic campaign information, such as the user-defined campaign name, the start date (and optionally the end date) of the campaign, the daily budget amount of the campaign, and the eBay marketplace where the campaign will be hosted. The seller must also identify the items they want to place in the campaign by adding the listing id of each item in the listingIds array of the request.

Using the provided listingIds, eBay creates ad groups for the campaign and organizes the listings into the appropriate ad group. eBay then adds keywords to each ad group and assigns each keyword a suggested bid.

By default, campaigns created using setupQuickCampaign utilize a FIXED keyword bidding strategy which means that a seller manually assigns and adjusts keyword bids for their CPC campaign.

Alternatively, once the campaign has been created, sellers may opt to utilize a DYNAMIC bidding strategy which means that eBay will manage a campaign's keyword bids and automatically update them daily to the suggested bid.

For additional information about FIXED and DYNAMIC bidding strategies, refer to updateBiddingStrategy.

Campaigns created using this method will be in DRAFT status upon creation.

The location response header returned contains the getCampaign URI to retrieve the newly created campaign that is in draft status. Sellers should make this call to review and approve the campaign before they use the launchCampaign method to start the campaign.

Note: General strategy ad campaigns are not supported.
data.summary_suggestion: Create a priority strategy campaign with auto-generated keywords
data.description_suggestion: Creates a priority strategy campaign with automatically generated ad groups, keywords, and suggested bids. Requires: campaign name, start date, daily budget, marketplace, and listingIds array. eBay automatically organizes listings into ad groups and assigns keywords with suggested bids. Returns HTTP 201 with Location header containing getCampaign URI. Campaign created in DRAFT status with FIXED bidding strategy by default (can be changed to DYNAMIC via updateBiddingStrategy). Review campaign via getCampaign before launching with launchCampaign. Note: General strategy campaigns not supported.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is lengthy and lacks clear return value specification. Improved summary emphasizes auto-generation feature. Enhanced description consolidates key requirements, clarifies return value (201 with Location header), specifies default bidding strategy, and provides clear workflow guidance for AI agents.

data.current_description:
This method clones (makes a copy of) the specified campaign's campaign criterion. The campaign criterion is a container for the fields that define the criteria for a rule-based campaign.

To clone a campaign, supply the campaign_id as a path parameter in your call. There is no request payload.

The ID of the newly-cloned campaign is returned in the Location response header.

Call getCampaigns to retrieve a seller's current campaign IDs.

Requirement: In order to clone a campaign, the campaignStatus must be ENDED and the campaign must define a set of selection rules (it must be a rules-based campaign).

Note: This method only applies to the Cost Per Sale (CPS) funding model; it does not apply to the Cost Per Click (CPC) funding model. See Funding Models in the Promoted Listings Playbook for more information.
data.summary_suggestion: Clone an ended rule-based campaign
data.description_suggestion: Creates a copy of an ended rule-based Promoted Listings campaign with its campaign criteria and selection rules. Requires the campaign_id as a path parameter; no request body needed. The campaign must have status ENDED and define selection rules (rules-based campaign). Only applies to Cost Per Sale (CPS) funding model campaigns. Returns the newly-cloned campaign ID in the Location response header. The cloned campaign starts in a paused state.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is lengthy but lacks clarity on prerequisites and state changes. Added concise summary, clarified CPS-only restriction upfront, and specified that cloned campaign starts paused for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
This method retrieves the details for all of the seller's defined campaigns. Request parameters can be used to retrieve a specific campaign, such as the campaign's name, the start and end date, the channel, the status, and the funding model (i.e., Cost Per Sale (CPS) or Cost Per Click (CPC)).

You can filter the result set by a campaign name, end date range, start date range, campaign channel, or campaign status. You can also paginate the records returned from the result set using the limit query parameter, and control which records to return using the offset parameter.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve seller's Promoted Listings campaigns
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all of the seller's Promoted Listings campaigns with optional filtering and pagination. Supports filtering by campaign name, status (RUNNING, PAUSED, ENDED), channel, start/end date ranges, and funding model (CPS or CPC). Use limit and offset parameters for pagination. Returns an array of campaign objects containing campaign details, criteria, and configuration. Use getCampaign to retrieve full details including selection rules for a specific campaign.

data.current_description:
This method can be used to create a Promoted Listings general, priority, or offsite campaign.

A Promoted Listings campaign is the structure in which you place the ads or ad group for the listings you wish to promote.

Note: Campaigns can only contain ads for a maximum of 50,000 items.
General strategy campaigns utilize a Cost Per Sale (CPS) funding model. Sellers can set the ad rate and bidding strategies that are right for their business through the adRateStrategy, biddingStrategy, bidPercentage fields. For more information on general strategy campaigns, see Promoted Listings general strategy campaign flow.

Priority strategy campaigns utilize a Cost per Click (CPC) funding model. Sellers can create a daily budget through the budget container and choose what channel that their ads appear on. In addition, priority strategy campaigns give sellers the ability to create ad groups and specify keywords to ensure their ads reach their intended audience. For more information on priority strategy campaigns, see Promoted listings priority strategy campaign flow.

Promoted Offsite campaigns give sellers the ability to create their own advertising campaign and promote their eBay listing in leading external search channels. For more information on Promoted Offsite campaigns, see Promoted Offsite.

Note: Sellers can use the getAdvertisingEligibility method of the Account API v1 to determine their eligibility status for eBay advertising programs.
To create a basic campaign, supply:
  • The user-defined campaign name
  • The start date (and optionally the end date) of the campaign
  • The eBay marketplace on which the campaign is hosted
  • Details on the campaign funding model
For details on creating Promoted Listings campaigns and how to select the items to be included in your campaigns, see Promoted Listings campaign creation.
data.summary_suggestion: Create a Promoted Listings campaign
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new Promoted Listings campaign (general, priority, or offsite strategy). Requires campaign name, start date, marketplace, and funding model details in the request body. General strategy campaigns use Cost Per Sale (CPS) funding with configurable ad rate and bidding strategies. Priority strategy campaigns use Cost Per Click (CPC) funding with daily budget and channel selection. Offsite campaigns promote listings on external search channels. Maximum 50,000 items per campaign. Returns the newly-created campaign ID. Verify seller eligibility using getAdvertisingEligibility before creating campaigns.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is verbose and lacks clear input/output structure. Added concise summary, reorganized funding model information, clarified required vs optional fields, and specified return value for AI agent clarity.
